intro: Bassia longicuspis, commonly known as the long-fruited bursaria, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pinkish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its unique features include elongated, spiny fruits that aid in seed dispersal by animals. Bassia longicuspis is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water availability.
